data.fullContent: Japan's power in Asia grew with the demise of the tsarist regime in Russia and the disorder of the 1917 Bolshevik Revolution in Siberia. Wanting to seize the opportunity, the Japanese army planned to occupy Siberia as far west as Lake Baikal. To do so, Japan had to negotiate an agreement with China allowing the transit of Japanese troops through Chinese territory. Although the force was scaled back to avoid antagonizing the United States, more than 70,000 Japanese troops joined the much smaller units of the Allied Expeditionary Force sent to Siberia in 1918.
data.answer: 日本在亚洲的势力随着俄罗斯沙皇政权的覆灭和1917年西伯利亚布尔什维克革命的动乱而增长。为了抓住这个机会，日本军队计划占领西伯利亚西部的贝加尔湖。为了做到这一点，日本必须与中国谈判达成一项允许日本军队通过中国领土过境的协议。尽管为了避免与美国对抗，日本军队进行了缩减，但仍有7万多名日本士兵加入了1918年被派往西伯利亚的盟军远征军(Allied Expeditionary force)，后者的规模要小得多。
